newsitem.title: HUNGARY: AIRPORT LJUBLJANA CARGO TRADE OFF 15.6 PCT JAN-MAY.
newsitem.headline: AIRPORT LJUBLJANA CARGO TRADE OFF 15.6 PCT JAN-MAY.

text.p: Ljubljana in the January-to-May period decreased 15.6 percent
in 1996 from 1995, according to data provided to Reuters by the
CARGO TRADE (in tonnes) JAN-MAY 96 JAN-MAY 95 PCT CHANGE
NOTE - Cargo includes freight and mail. In the trade
balance, negative numbers indicate export deficits; positive
numbers indicate export surpluses. Due to rounding, some data
in this report differ fractionally when appearing in other
The airport has approximately 4,000 square meters of
warehouse space with annual capacity to store 15,000 tonnes of
cargo. The space includes 82 cubic centimeters of capacity for
cold storage, and rooms are available for dangerous goods, live
animals, plants, radioactive material and valuables.
Cargo trade at the airport totalled 10,499 tonnes in 1995.
The airport, officially named Aerodrom Ljubljana po
Brnik, is owned 55.69 percent by the Slovenian state, 16.34
percent by past and present airport employees, 10.25 percent by
holders of airport equity sold publicly, 8.86 percent by the
Slovenian Fund for Development, 4.43 percent by the Slovenian
State Indemnity Fund and 4.43 percent by the Slovenian State
